intro: Senecio araucanus, commonly known as the Araucanian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Senecio araucanus is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh mountainous climates.
